column4: can anyone give me a hand figuring out why my USB flash drive doesn't show up on my desktop when the system can see that it's plugged in? I also don't know how to unmount it ...unless I just do that from terminal
System -> Preferences -> Removable Media and Disks, make sure you have the correct options set
those settings appear to be correct
okay, then in a terminal, type gnome-volume-manager
: should I sudo that?
nope
yeah...weird. okay, try putting a drive-mount applet in your panel and see if that helps
drive mount works when I insert a cdrom... will this break anything? :)
i have my drives show up in the applet when i insert stuff in there
it should just work, and photo importer should import photos automagically
that would just be too easy :)  thanks!
it doesn't remove them from the camera when it imports them does it?
i don't think so
ok thanks
i only did it once, and it worked very well on my friends camera
ok... I'll give it a go

amazing... not only discovered the camera and opened photo importer, but also correctly identified the camera and it does have a checkbox to remove them from the camera after importing. Absolutely brilliant.
do we have to dismount the camera somehow? Or just unplug it when we're done?
try to unmount it, and then unplug. i am pretty sure that it mounts it as a usb disk :)
I can't see it mounted in /media ... hmmmmm
you don't have to if you don't want to!
ok... then I'm amazed! :)
though for kernel updates to be applied, you would need a reboot. i guess anything not being used is updated and can be used immediately
